meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting an enzyme that breaks down proteins into smaller peptides.
meanings.sent1: The chymotryptic enzyme helped break down the protein into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the chymotryptic process of protein digestion.
meanings.sent3: The chymotryptic enzyme was so efficient, it could break down a whole steak in seconds!
meanings.sent4: Her sharp wit was like a chymotryptic enzyme, breaking down complex ideas into simpler forms.
meanings.sent5: The chymotryptic action of the enzyme was like a tiny worker diligently chopping a large tree into small branches.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to chymotrypsin, an enzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of proteins.
meanings.sent1: The chymotryptic reaction catalyzed by the enzyme was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: Doctors often use chymotryptic enzymes to aid in protein digestion.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that the chymotryptic enzyme in his stomach could digest anything, even rocks!
meanings.sent4: Her words had a chymotryptic effect, breaking down barriers between people.
meanings.sent5: The chymotryptic power of the enzyme was like a superhero, swiftly breaking down any protein it encountered.
